columns.text: In this problem, we will determine whether it is still beneficial for a person to get an MBA.

When deciding on whether to continue pursuing a higher educational degree, the age of the person is always an important factor to consider. This is important since enrolling in another degree program or a higher educational attainment is considered as an investment.

Investments such as this are often viewed based on the number of years before they reach the return of investment. This means that we need to evaluate whether the investment in question will provide the appropriate return as compared to foregoing the MBA and just working full time.

Since we are looking at the rate of return, then it is essential to understand the age of the person since each person can only work for a limited number of years before retirement. We can see from the problem that taking the MBA will result in an increase in the salary of the person.

Since he plans to work until he is $66$ years old, then taking the MBA is a wise decision as he only needs to undergo two years of unemployment to achieve a significantly higher salary for the next $36$ years until he retires.

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
